title: Understanding Quadrilaterals and Triangles Through STEM-Based Project Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic geometric concepts (line segments, angles, polygon classification) and simple measurements (length, area)
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops), providing basic toolkits for on-site production activities

learning_goals: Students can accurately explain geometric properties (sides, angles, symmetry) of quadrilaterals and triangles by over 80% while constructing rubber-band-powered car projects.
Students can solve perimeter/area calculation problems for quadrilaterals and triangles applied to real-life issues (road design, building structures) with over 75% accuracy.
Students can submit 100% of learning outcomes integrating STEM elements (measurement, design, testing) through collaborative projects.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
